explains: adj. 预感的；不祥之兆的

sentences.en: She had a sense of foreboding that the news would be bad.
sentences.cn: 她预感到这会是坏消息。

sentences.en: The letter filled him with foreboding.
sentences.cn: 这封信使他充满了不祥的预感。

sentences.en: His triumph was overshadowed by an uneasy sense of foreboding.
sentences.cn: 他的成功被一种令人心神不安的不祥之感所笼罩。
